channel.title: Velociraptor Artifact Exchange
channel.description: Recent content in Artifact Exchange on Velociraptor - Digging deeper!

item.title: Windows.Detection.TeamViewerLanguage
item.description: This artifact enables collection of TeamViewer log entries for keyboard layout changes.

item.title: MacOS.Network.DHCP
item.description: It can be useful to view DHCP lease information on an endpoint. If the `LeaseLength`, `RouterIPAddress`, `SSID`, or other values are not as expected, it could potentially indicate a rogue DHCP server on the network, or just misconfiguration.

item.title: IRIS.Sync.Asset
item.description: This artifact synchronizes clients from Velociraptor to DFIR-IRIS (https://dfir-iris.org/). It will parse available information of clients such as network interfaces, IP addresses, asset type and applied labels. Once it has been added, the asset ID from DFIR-IRIS will be added as client metadata and 'IRIS' will be added as label. If this artifact is applied on a client that has the asset ID set in its metadata, it won't be readded but rather updated: Labels and the compromised status will by synchronized.

item.title: Linux.Forensics.RecentlyUsed
item.description: Parses the 'recently-used.xbel' XML file for all standard Linux users.

item.title: Linux.System.PAM
item.description: This artifact enumerates applicable lines from the files that reside in `/etc/PAM.d/`. This information can be useful for auditing and compliance purposes, or to identify suspicious activity on Linux systems.

item.title: MacOS.Applications.SavedState
item.description: On macOS, certain application state is saved in `/Users/*/Library/Saved Application State/`.

item.title: Server.Enrichment.OpenAI
item.description: Query OpenAI for analysis of data.

item.title: Server.Alerts.GenericMonitor
item.description: This is a template artifact to allow alerting on a monitoring artifact.

item.title: Linux.Sys.APTHistory
item.description: APT (Advanced Package Tool) maintains a log of software installation/removal/upgrades, as well as associated command-line invocations.

item.title: MacOS.System.MountedDiskImages
item.description: This artifact checks for mounted disk images using the `hdiutil` command.

item.title: Windows.Remediation.Glob
item.description: This artifact uses glob to remove a file or folder. To recursively target a folder: ```C:\folder\path{,\**}``` To target multiple folders: ```C:\{folder2\path2{,\**},folder\path{,\**}}``` however advised to just run 2 collections... WARNING: There has been a bug in older versions of Velociraptor that ```\**``` glob path will select all files. PLEASE SCOPE FIRST and use appropriate targeting.

item.title: Linux.Sys.JournalCtl
item.description: Parse the output of the journalctl command. Journalctl is an interface to the systemd journal, which records information about system events.

item.title: MacOS.Applications.NetworkUsage
item.description: On macOS, the NetUsage DB can provide various details around application network utilization. With this artifact, we can get an idea of what applications are utilizing the network for communications and to what degree. We can also identify if usage has occurred through a WIFI network or a wired network.

item.title: Windows.Remediation.Process
item.description: This artifact enables killing a process by Name, Path or PID.

item.title: Windows.Remediation.Registry
item.description: This artifact uses glob to remove a registry key.

item.title: MacOS.Applications.KnowledgeC
item.description: On macOS, the KnowledgeC DB can provide various details around application activities and usage, as well as device power status.

item.title: Windows.EventLogs.EvtxHussar
item.description: Grab important events from Windows logs (.evtx) using [EvtxHussar](https://github.com/yarox24/EvtxHussar). Also upload PowerShell ScriptBlocks (reconstructed as files).

item.title: Server.Notification.Mastodon
item.description: Create a post on a Mastodon server. This could be used for automated alerting purposes, sharing IOCs, etc.

item.title: MacOS.Applications.Cache
item.description: Applications can use the NSURL cache to store specific data that is useful to the operation of the application in a `Cache.db` file on disk. The data contained within this file could potentially be useful to investigators or incident responders, such as URLs that were accessed, as well as data requested or returned.

item.title: Windows.Triage.Sysmon
item.description: This artifact allows collecting Sysmon Events for Triage around a timestamp.

item.title: Server.Import.DetectRaptor
item.description: This artifact will automatically import the latest DetectRaptor bundle into the current server.

item.title: MacOS.Sys.BashHistory
item.description: This artifact is a modified version of the Linux.Sys.BashHistory artifact that enables grep of Bash and alternate shell history and *session* files.

item.title: Windows.Detection.Termsrv
item.description: This artifact detects patched TerminalService dynamic link library - termsrv.dll.

item.title: MacOS.Sys.Automator
item.description: This artifact collects information about Automator actions and workflows.

item.title: Linux.Sys.SystemdTimer
item.description: List and parse content of Systemd timers.

item.title: Windows.System.VAD
item.description: This artifact enables enumeration of process memory sections via the Virtual Address Descriptor (VAD). The VAD is used by the Windows memory manager to describe allocated process memory ranges.

item.title: Windows.EventLogs.RPCFirewall
item.description: Collect RPC Firewall logs from Windows hosts

item.title: MacOS.Network.ApplicationLayerFirewall
item.description: This artifact provides information around the configuration of the application firewall for a macOS host.

item.title: Server.Utils.QuerySummary
item.description: Takes a query and outputs number of unique items per column, as well as the top 10 most frequently occuring items

item.title: Windows.EventLogs.Aurora
item.description: This artifact is a wrapper around the Windows.EventLogs.EvtxHunter artifact. It searches the Windows Application event log for logs being written by Nextron System's Aurora/Aurora Lite ('AuroraAgent' provider).

item.title: MacOS.Network.Bluetooth
item.description: Collect information about connected or paired Bluetooth-enabled devices.

item.title: Windows.Carving.SystemBC
item.description: This artifact extracts SystemBC RAT configuration from a byte stream, process or file on disk.

item.title: Windows.System.Shares
item.description: This artifact will extract network shares per machine.

item.title: MacOS.Network.RecentWifiNetworks
item.description: This artifact looks for recent Wifi networks to which a host has joined. This can be useful in determining where a machine has been, or if a user has joined an illegitimate or unauthorized wireless network. *Tested on macOS Monterey

item.title: Server.Monitor.Autolabeling.Clients
item.description: This server side event monitoring artifact watches for new client enrollments and automatically labels them according to their domain roles.

item.title: Windows.Applications.AnyDesk
item.description: This parses AnyDesk logs to retrieve information about AnyDesk usage. It includes source IP addresses, AnyDesk ID's, and filetransfers.

item.title: Windows.Carving.BRc4
item.description: This artifact extracts Brute Ratel C4 (BRc4) configuration from a byte stream, process or file on disk. BRc4 is an emerging red-teaming and adversarial attack simulation tool.

item.title: MacOS.Collection.Aftermath
item.description: This is a simple artifact that leverages Afermath to collect many different forensic artifacts from a macOS host, then uploads the results to the Velociraptor server.

item.title: Windows.Detection.ISOMount
item.description: Following Microsoft's decision to block macros by default on MS Office applications, threat actors are increasingly using container files such as ISO files to distribute malware. This artifact will extract evidence of .iso files being mounted that may be malicious from the Microsoft-Windows-VHDMP-Operational EventLog. The artifact targets the string ".iso" in event IDs: 1 (mount), 2 (unmount) and 12 (type, path, handle).

item.title: MacOS.ParallelsVM.SuspendedMemory
item.description: Looks for suspended Parallels VM owned by any user on a MacOS system. Can automatically upload the virtual memory files if found.

item.title: Windows.Detection.Malfind
item.description: This artifact checks the VAD for executable sections that are not maped to disk and has suspicious content which may indicate process injection.

item.title: Windows.ETW.Powershell
item.description: This artifact enables Powershell scriptblock and commandlet load monitoring. It uses the ETW provider: Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell

item.title: MacOS.UnifiedLogParser
item.description: This is a simple, un-optimized artifact that leverages Mandiant's `macos-unifiedlogs`/`unifiedlog_parser` to obtain parsed log information from macOS's Unified Log.

item.title: Windows.ETW.DNSOfflineCollector
item.description: This artifact collects DNS queries for a specified duration. It can be used with an Offline Collector (which is not the case with Windows.ETW.DNS). It uses the artifact (Windows.ETW.DNS) that was built by Matt Green - @mgreen27

item.title: Server.Alerts.IRIS.Case.Create
item.description: Create an IRIS case when monitored artifacts complete with results. Adds the ClientId, FlowId as tags to the case. Adds the FQDN as an asset.

item.title: Server.Enrichment.IRIS.IOCLookup
item.description: Query an IRIS instance for an indicator.

item.title: Windows.Registry.COMAutoApprovalList
item.description: This artifact will return COM objects that auto-elevate and bypass UAC (these could potentially be used by adversaries/malware to elevate privileges), and cross-reference the class ID with a name where able.

item.title: Windows.Detection.MagicWeb
item.description: This artifact will find evidence of NOBELIUM’s MagicWeb.

item.title: Windows.System.Services.SliverPsexec
item.description: This pack detects various artefacts left behind by default configurations of the C2 framework Sliver PsExec module

item.title: Windows.Detection.UnattendXML
item.description: This artifact will find unscrubbed passwords in unattend.xml answer files. This file is used for non interactive Windows installation.
